note.p: Birth: Bouverie Street, Whitefriars, England (03 June 1834)
Education: Royal School of Mines, Kensington; Freiburg, Saxony

Career: Worked for the Geological Survey of India (1855); retired due to ill health (1862); Professor, Presidency College, Calcutta (to 1872); Meteorological Reporter to the Government of India; retired and returned to England (1888)
Memberships: FGS; Assoc Roy School of Mines.
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1893 vol 54 pp xii-xix signed by W T B
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
